page.title: 13Village Hall, Staploe
page.content: The village hall built in 1954, with money raised locally stands on leasehold land, beside the cricket field, loaned by a farmer. The Committee drawn from Duloe and Staploe only, organizes events each year, to upkeep the structure, (a whist drive, a Christmas Carol bazaar and a Summer gymkhana bazaar.) Regular users are the cricket club, over 60's, Social Club and Council. More intermittently, weddings, private parties and courses e.g. dancing. Charges are moderate with winter heating additional. The over 60's club enjoys preferential rates. Owing to it's scattered population the public uses additional venues. Honeydon's pleasantly small chapel is used for winter Council meetings and a Barn at Chestnuts Farm is licensed and complies with fire regulationsfor events. e.g. Halloween.
